com.yantra.api.omp.order

Interface reshipOrderLines

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface reshipOrderLines

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document reshipOrderLines(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The reshipOrderLines API creates new order lines to fulfill the reshipment of the order lines passed in the input.

    • Method Detail

      • reshipOrderLines

        org.w3c.dom.Document reshipOrderLines(YFSEnvironment env,
                                      org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                               throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                      java.rmi.RemoteException

        The reshipOrderLines API creates new order lines to fulfill the reshipment of the order lines passed in the input.

        Attributes on the new order lines created by the reshipOrderLines API can be controlled by the ReshipOrderLines document template for the order's document type, as well as by the YFSReshipOrderLinesUE

        . If OrderLineOptions and its CustomAttributes are allowed in ReshipOrderLines template, OrderLineOptions and its CustomAttributes are copied to new order line.

        Additional validation may be done by the YFSReshipOrderLinesUE. This user exit may cause the API to return a different ReshipMessage from those listed above.

        The order lines created by reshipOrderLines will be identical to newly created order lines, with the exception that reshipOrderLines will set the IsPriceLocked flag and IsLinePriceForInformationOnly for the new line to Y, which will suppress system pricing from assigning a unit price to the line and considering the line for pricig rules if the enhanced pricing engine is in use. This behavior can be overridden by the user exit.

        If passed line is a bundle parent then order lines are created for all its product components. Parent-Child relationship is established on newly created lines. This behavior can be overridden by the user exit. Components that do not maintain KitQty are copied from their original order line.

        If the IsManual flag for a charge on an order line is set to Y the discount value will not be disabled from the sales order

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: This API invokes the following user exits:

          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSReshipOrderLinesUE - Invoked unconditionally if implemented.

        Events Raised:

        ON_ORDER_RELEASE_STATUS_CHANGE:

          This event is raised when an order release status is changed for the order.
          Data published - YFS_ORDER_CHANGE.ON_ORDER_RELEASE_STATUS_CHANGE.xml
          Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt
          Template Support - Yes.

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document describing the final order state. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
